intro: Galactia irwinii, commonly known as the Irwin's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Galactia irwinii typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in desert ecosystems.
